November 5, 2022

Painting, Part II

By Joseph Kibe

The painters have been back and continue to make progress. I made one small mistake that hopefully isn’t too hard to remediate. Most dramatically, they’ve gotten the plywood ready for the millwork installation.

November 3, 2022

Painting Begins

By Joseph Kibe

Progress has resumed with a few visits from the painting crew. Their work is an object lesson in the value of painting and the benefit of hiring true professionals to do the work. No, painting isn’t that difficult. But it’s clear that people who do this for a living know what they’re doing.

Continue reading →

Closing

By Joseph Kibe

The building inspector gave clearance on closing the two remaining walls. It’s a tantalizing taste of progress. On the other hand, there are still a few remaining hiccups.
